intro: Crotalaria forbesii var. vanmeelii, commonly known as the Vanmeel's crotalaria, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The seeds are encased in hard pods, which contribute to its ecological role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling.
